III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/29/24, Youth A reported to medical staff that they were sore
on the left side of the body. There was a contusion on the left hip.
Youth A reported on 12/27/24, he was involved in a verbal and
physical altercation with Staff 1. Staff 1 attempted to restrain
Youth A and pushed Youth A in the chest and the youth returned
the same action. Youth A fell to the ground and Staff 1 had their
hand around the Youth A’s neck and then their arm around the
Youth A’s neck.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone 01/03/2025
Administrator was interviewed on 01/07/2025 at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Administrator reported he is
aware of the incident and Youth A did not report being assaulted
by Staff 1 until two days later. Administrator reviewed the video
footage and did not see Staff 1 assault or try to restrain Youth A.
He said Youth A is the one that punched and pulled Staff 1’s hair.
Administrator said Staff 1 is very direct and does not react when a
youth gets aggressive. Staff 1 has been reassigned to another
Pod and will not be working with Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/07/2025 at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 has been working at
the facility for seven months and has completed all training. Staff 1
is 6’11 tall and weighs 280 pounds. Staff 1 denied having any
discipline reports in his employee file. Staff 1 reported on the
evening of 12/27/2024, Youth A reported his toilet was not working
and wanted to move to another room. Staff 1 went to the
bedroom, flushed the toilet and it was working. Youth A followed
him to the bedroom and when Staff 1 told Youth A the toilet was
working, Youth A yelled at Staff 1, punched Staff 1 in the face, and
pulled his hair. Staff 2 immediately intervened and stood between
Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 1 denied punching, choking, or hitting
Youth A. Staff 1 said he put his hand up to block Youth A’s punch,
but denied pushing Youth A. He does not recall Youth A falling or
2

getting hurt. He immediately walked out of the bedroom and
Manager and Supervisor came on the pod and spoke with Youth
A.
Supervisor was interviewed on 01/07/2025 at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor has been
working at the facility for six years. Supervisor recalled the
incident on 12/27/2024. He reported being called to Pod 1,
however when he and Manger arrived on the pod the situation had
been de-escalated and Staff 1 was not in Youth A’s bedroom but
was walking out of Youth A's bedroom. Supervisor said he and
Manager spoke with Youth A after the incident. Youth A did not
report Staff 1 choked or pushed him and Youth A denied having
any injuries. Supervisor reported Youth A is easily triggered when
he does not get his way and that was the reason he was
escalated that day. Supervisor denied witnessing Staff 1 being
aggressive with any youth.
Youth A was interviewed on 01/07/2025 at the facility, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the
facility for almost two weeks and is placed on Pod 1. Youth A was
observed with a bruise on the left side of his face, which he said is
from getting into a fight with Youth B. Youth A said staff did
intervene and stopped the fight. Youth A recalled the incident
involving Staff 1 and said he does not like Staff 1 because he took
the pod’s remote control for several days. He said someone on
the pod took the video game remote controller and because no
one would say who had it or give it back, Staff 1 took the television
remote control. Youth A reported on 12/27/24 he had asked Staff
1 to switch rooms because the toilet was not flushing, and Staff 1
went to his bedroom to check the toilet. He said that made him
angry and he told Staff 1 to get out of his bedroom. Staff 1 pushed
him back on his side. Youth A said he then pushed, punched, and
pulled Staff 1’s hair, and that’s when Staff 1 grabbed Youth A by
the neck. He said Staff 2 came and stood between him and Staff
1. Youth A said Staff 2 told Staff 1 to leave and Staff 1 walked out
of his room. Youth A said his side was hurting after the incident
and was seen by the nurse. Youth A told staff that his side was
hurting him, however Youth A could not remember when or which
staff he reported his side was hurting him to. Youth A reported that
he feels safe and did not express any concerns regarding any
other staff.
Youth B was interviewed on 01/07/2025 at the facility, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the
3

facility for several months and is placed on Pod 1. Youth B
admitted he and Youth A got into a fight on 12/30/2024, because
Youth A was threatening him. He said staff intervened and
stopped the fight. Youth B said on 12/27/2024 he was on a home
pass and did not witness the incident involving Youth A and Staff
1. Youth B said his favorite staff is Staff 1. Youth B denied ever
witnessing Staff 1 get aggressive or assault any youth. Youth B
reported feeling safe and did not express any concerns regarding
staff.
Youth C was interviewed on 01/07/2025 at the facility, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the
facility for several months and is placed on Pod 1. Youth C
recalled the incident involving Youth A and Staff 1 and said Youth
A was cussing at Staff 1 because he wanted to change rooms. He
said Staff 1 went into Youth A’s bedroom to check the toilet and
that’s when Youth A ran to his room. He said Youth A tried to
swing on Staff 1 and Staff 1 put his hand tried to block Youth A’s
punch. He denied witnessing Staff 1 punch or choked Youth A. He
said Youth A was jumping trying to reach Staff 1, because Staff 1
is very tall. He said Youth A got up and again started swinging on
Staff 1, and that’s when Staff 2 intervened. Youth C denied
witnessing Staff 1 being aggressive with any youth at the facility.
Youth C said he witnessed the fight between Youth A and Youth B
on 12/30/24. He said staff immediately intervened and separated
Youth A and Youth B. Youth C reported feeling safe at the facility.
Nurse was interviewed on 01/07/2025 at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Nurse confirmed she
examined Youth A on 12/29/2024 for left side pain. Youth A was
found to have a small circular bruise on his left side above his hip.
She said Youth A reported Staff 1 entered his room, grabbed him
by the neck, and punched him on his left side. She said Youth A
was not observed to have any injuries or bruises on his neck or
face.
Therapist was interviewed on 01/27/2025 at the facility, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Therapist reported she has
weekly individual therapy sessions with Youth A, and Youth A has
never reported any concerns regarding Staff 1. She was not
aware of this incident because she was off for two weeks during
the holidays.
Manager was interviewed on 01/27/2025 via telephone, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Manager reported he
responded to a call for assistance on 12/27/2024 on Pod 1. When
4

Manager arrived on the pod, Staff 1 was exiting Youth A’s
bedroom. He witnessed Youth A trying to swing at Staff 1 and
Staff 2 was standing between Youth A and Staff 1. Manager told
Staff 1 to leave the pod. Manager and Supervisor debriefed with
Youth A after the incident. Youth A did not report falling or his side
was hurting. Manager reported Youth A’s face and neck were red,
but Youth A did not report he was choked or needing medical
attention. Manager denied witnessing or having any reports
regarding Staff 1 being aggressive with any youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 01/29/2025 at the facility, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 was working on Pod
1 on 12/27/2024. He reported going to Youth A’s bedroom during
the incident and witnessed Youth A punching and pulling Staff 1’s
hair, and Staff 1 had his hands up trying to block Youth A’s
punches. He got in between Staff 1 and Youth A, and Staff 1
stepped out of the room. Staff 2 denied witnessing Staff 1 punch,
push, or choke Youth A. He said Youth A was escalated and was
the aggressor. He denied witnessing Youth A fall or be pushed
onto the floor. He said Youth A did not report Staff 1 choked or
hurt him, however Youth A was bragging that he beat up Staff 1.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage was reviewed of the incident (note: video has no
audio). Video date 12/27/2024 at approximately 8:45 pm. Staff 1 is
observed talking to Youth A in the common area of the pod. Staff
1 went into Youth A’s bedroom and Youth A followed him to the
bedroom. Two staff members entered the pod and walked to
Youth A’s room and then Staff 1 walked out of the bedroom. Youth
A followed Staff 1 out and spoke to Manager and Supervisor. Staff
1 was in the bedroom with Youth A for less than one minute.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 12/27/2025, written by Manager
noted: Youth A requested to change his room because the
toilet was not working, Staff 1 checked the toilet and it was
working, Staff 1 told Youth A he was not going to change
his room because the toilet was working, Youth A assaulted
Staff 1 by pulling his hair, Manager arrived on the scene
and assist with verbally de-escalating Youth A. No injuries
reported.
• Medical assessment dated 12/29/2024. Youth A was
examined by the nurse for pain on his left side. Youth A
had a reddish and purple discoloration on his lower left his
abdomen area. Youth A reported Staff 1 punched him on
his left side on 12/27/2024.
5

• Staff 1’s personnel file; there was no disciplinary record. He
completed Mandt system verbal de-escalation training on
08/30/24.
• Facility youth and discipline and behavior management
policy prohibits any type of physical discipline. The use of
verbal and non-physical crisis intervention should be
utilized first and may prevent the need for physical
intervention. The appropriate staff response is to use a safe
physical management procedure to control the youth and
then use the Behavior Management Procedure until the
youth is under physical and emotional control
Analysis Based on interviews conducted, video footage and documentation
reviewed, there is insufficient evidence to support the allegations
that Staff 1 pushed, choked, or hurt Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
